AC Milan boss Stefano Pioli has asked Paolo Maldini and Ricky Massara for four more signings to complete his squad, a report claims.

Having already got deals for Sandro Tonali and Brahim Diaz over the line, Pioli is determined to secure at least two options in every position in his 4-2-3-1.


According to Calciomercato.com, in addition to the re-signing of Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Pioli asked for nine reinforcements from the club this summer when he signed his new deal.

The market has so far given the confirmation of Ibrahimovic, Kjaer and Saelemaekers, plus Brahim and Tonali, but there are still four areas that need addressing.

Pioli has asked for a reinforcement in the full-back department, possibly on the right with the possibility that one of Conti or Calabria leaves.

In defence he wants another signing to join Romagnoli and Kjaer, but one of Duarte or Musacchio must leave first. Then, a new deputy to Gianluigi Donnarumma will have to arrive too.

Finally, Pioli wants another central midfielder. Tiemoué Bakayoko is the player on the radar, but currently there are difficulties regarding the operation.

Then, in the last days of the transfer market there could be opportunities suitable for Milan.

replies.msg:
Alessio Romagnoli and Simon Kjaer will be the centre-back pairing at the start of this season. However, Milan also need competent alternatives for rotation, which is something that they are lacking for the time being.

According to Gazzetta Dello Sport, it’s no secret that Stefano Pioli likes Nikola Milenkovic a lot, as well as Federico Chiesa. Both will expire in 2022 but Fiorentina have made their demands clear: they are unsellable bar any big offers.


Milan admire both players, as said, but the hidden work mainly concerns the Serbian international. La Viola value him at around €40m, which is a figure that the Rossoneri can’t pay for the time being.

They could, however, try to secure the 23-year-old with ‘Tonali-esque’ offer: a paid loan with an option to buy and bonuses on top of that. It remains to be seen if Milan will make a move, though they would have to sell a defender first.

The most likely suspect is Leo Duarte, who has been disastrous during pre-season so far, failing to perform against lower-level sides Novara and Monza.

Milan have managed to secure the services of Brahim Diaz and Sandro Tonali, but they are clearly not done on the transfer market yet. Another meeting was scheduled for today regarding three players, a report claims.

According to reports from MilanNews.it, Fabio Parisi and Stefano Antonelli arrived at Casa Milan a short moment ago to meet with the Rossoneri management. In fact, the intermediaries have proposed three players to the club.



They are Marcos Senesi of Feyenoord (centre-back), Vitalij Mykolenko (left-back) and Vladyslav Supriaha (striker) of Dinamo Kyiv. As added by Daniele Longo, who only mentioned Mykolenko, the meeting is with sporting director Ricky Massara.

Among other things, the Rossoneri need to bring in a backup left-back as the current alternative is Diego Laxalt, who hasn’t exactly impressed since he joined from Genoa. It remains to be seen if they will make a move for either of these players.

Leo Duarte’s performances against Novara and Monza revealed a serious flaw in Milan’s squad and they are now looking to buy a centre-back. Stefano Pioli needs a reliable player who can alternate with the current starters.

According to SportMediaset, as cited by Milanlive.it, Duarte is expected to leave Milan before the transfer window closes. The next destination hasn’t been found yet but the Rossoneri are working on it in order to sign a new centre-back.

又傳milenkovic


Paolo Maldini and Ricky Massara, the directors, want to buy a player that already knows Serie A well. Fiorentina duo Nikola Milenkovic and German Pezzella are two players on the list, but the price tags are too high for the time being.

replies.msg: 笑到

Lega Serie A President Paolo Dal Pino believes Italian football is on the right track with two fundamental changes, a media company and stadium restructuring laws.

Today, the Lega Serie A voted unanimously with all 20 clubs to create a global media company that will help negotiate and sell TV and commercial rights around the world.

This week, the Senate in Italy will vote to pass a change in the laws which currently limit restructuring of old stadiums or the building of new arenas, which should end the impasse for clubs including Fiorentina, Roma, Milan and Inter.

“Tomorrow’s law is a mandatory step to relaunch our football,” said Dal Pino in a press conference.

“Italian stadiums need to be modernised and the red tape has to be simplified to keep up with the pace set by other European leagues.

“Top level stadiums can also allow us to create a better product of our football that can then be sold.”

Of course, right now the stadiums are all shut because of the COVID pandemic, and the Government’s latest decree ruled there cannot be fans present at least until October.

“Another issue we approached with the FIGC and Government today was regarding access to stadiums and the medical protocol,” continued Dal Pino.

“It is absurd that up to 1,000 people can be allowed in to watch a friendly, but nobody for an official match. Health comes first, prudence is important, but it has to be done right.

“In a stadium that holds 80,000 people, how can you not allow at least some supporters in with social distancing? We cannot continue to play behind closed doors.”

When it comes to the media company creation, Dal Pino discussed the need for this revolutionary step in Italy, one that is very common elsewhere.

“Football is also entertainment and the creation of content. Speaking to important international media managers, I realised we have to take hold of our own destiny and to do that, we need investment in resources and new structures.

“It’s a colossal challenge, technology has changed everything. The Lega Serie A for many years worked with intermediaries, but it’s not enough, we have to keep that value in-house.

“Just 10 years ago, Serie A was second in Europe’s top leagues, now we have fallen behind the Bundesliga and La Liga. We need financial stability right now, because it’s a delicate time, so we need a business approach and right now, we don’t have that.”

Lucas Paqueta is on the market and AC Milan are willing to listen to offers for the services of the Brazilian midfielder. The player arrived from Flamengo a year and a half ago for a figure close to 40 million euros, but never managed to make a difference for the Rossoneri.

For this reason, Milan are ready to sell the player, with a potential cash income helping the club to operate further on the transfer market.


The most interested side seems to by Lyon, as confirmed by various sources in Italy, from Sky Sport to Gazzetta dello Sport as well as Milannews.it.

Yesterday evening confirmations also arrived from France, in particular, L’Equipe, one of the most prominent newspapers in the country.

However, it didn’t take too long for Jean-Michel Aulas, Lyon’s eccentric president, to respond to the rumours of talks about Paqueta’s arrival. The French businessman wrote a post on Twitter, denying the interest of his club in the former Flamengo player.

“Many inaccuracies, false information. It’s sad when you know the reality of seeing so many improbabilities on the part of L’Equipe,” he wrote

Among other things, Milan need to bring in a left-back before the transfer window closes. Theo Hernandez is the undisputed started but as the Rossoneri will feature in three competitions, he can’t play every game.

Stefano Pioli currently has Diego Laxalt at his disposal for this role, but the Uruguayan is expected to leave the club after failing to impress on the management. By the looks of it, Milan want to focus on a young profile for the role.

According to Corriere Dello Sport (via Milanlive.it), there are three names on Paolo Maldini and Ricky Massara’s shortlist. The first is the 21-year-old Ukrainian Vitaliy Mykolenko and Milan have already made initial contacts through intermediaries.

Then there is the Nuno Mendes option. The 18-year-old plats for Sporting Lisbon and could become a concrete target for Milan. However, they need to watch out for the competition as Arsenal also are interested.

Finally, the most recent addition on the list is Alejandro Balde. The 17-year-old plays for Barcelona’s youth team but many believe that he’s ready for the big leap. One thing is certain, the Hernandez deputy will be a young player.

Among other things, Milan need to bring in a left-back before the transfer window closes. Theo Hernandez is the undisputed started but as the Rossoneri will feature in three competitions, he can’t play every game.

Stefano Pioli currently has Diego Laxalt at his disposal for this role, but the Uruguayan is expected to leave the club after failing to impress on the management. By the looks of it, Milan want to focus on a young profile for the role.

According to Corriere Dello Sport (via Milanlive.it), there are three names on Paolo Maldini and Ricky Massara’s shortlist. The first is the 21-year-old Ukrainian Vitaliy Mykolenko and Milan have already made initial contacts through intermediaries.

Then there is the Nuno Mendes option. The 18-year-old plats for Sporting Lisbon and could become a concrete target for Milan. However, they need to watch out for the competition as Arsenal also are interested.

Finally, the most recent addition on the list is Alejandro Balde. The 17-year-old plays for Barcelona’s youth team but many believe that he’s ready for the big leap. One thing is certain, the Hernandez deputy will be a young player.
